bibliographic_metadata.Title: Deep GMDH Neural Networks for Predictive Mapping of Mineral Prospectivity in Terrains Hosting Few but Large Mineral Deposits
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Mohammad Parsa, Emmanuel John M. Carranza, Bahman Ahmadi

abstract: This study demonstrates the application of GMDH neural networks for mineral prospectivity mapping (MPM) in terrains hosting few but large mineral deposits. Coupled with a window-based data augmentation technique, GMDH networks yield robust predictive models that effectively manage the bias–variance tradeoff, making this methodology a viable option for MPM.
methodology: supervised > neural networks > feedforward neural network (MLP); knowledge-driven > probabilistic > weights of evidence (WofE)
key_points: GMDH neural networks are effective for mineral prospectivity mapping.
Data augmentation techniques improve model performance in data-scarce environments.
The study focuses on a district with few but large porphyry copper deposits.
The methodology addresses the bias-variance tradeoff in predictive modeling.
